governance: Run by elected board of directors
description: SHIA JAFARIAIEC of Fatema Zahra in Birmingham was established in order to promote, implement and adhere to the shining Islamic teaching of Ahlulbait peace be upon them through the following: to raise, educate and teach the children the Holy Quran, the teaching of Ahlulbait, the Islamic studies and the Arabic language, and to revive the Occasions of Ahlulbait and to provide a Musalah for every day prayer. 3. In order for this message to be reached by all Moslems and non-Moslems.. Added on August 19, 2010 and last updated 10 years ago

SUNNII-65 to exit 242, then east on Highway 52 East for about one mile to the intersection of Highway 11. Turn left on Highway 11 North and go about 50 yards (half the length of a football or soccer field. If you see the gas station you have gone too far.) Turn right at Highway 332 East. Cross the train tracks and enter the second gate on your left. This gate is about the length of a football field past the train tracks. 1009 will be on the mailbox. Added on July 22, 2012 and last updated 12 years ago

governance: Run by elected board of directors
description: SUNNIOur mission is to provide the right Islamic environment for the children where their foundation can be built upon strong Islamic belief and practices. We want our future generation to be strong Muslims who appreciate the gift of Islam. It is also our mission to maintain the highest quality in both Islamic and worldly education, allowing the children to grow up as learned and confident individuals.​ Added on January 11, 2019 and last updated 5 years ago

SUNNIFounded in 2006, the East Montgomery Islamic Society (EMIS) was established to serve the Muslim family and community of Montgomery, Alabama. Since its' founding, it has continued to grow and thrive, and we are now embarking on a new journey to build our own mosque! Added on January 18, 2019 and last updated 5 years ago

description: SUNNIThe Birmingham Islamic Society Hoover Crescent Islamic Center. Holds 5 daily prayers plus weekly Jummah Prayer. Offers various classes and services to the community. Houses the BIS administrative office. Please check the website for more information. Added on July 22, 2008 and last updated 2 years ago

SUNNIThe Birmingham Islamic Society Homewood Masjid serves as a place of 5 daily prayers plus weekly Jummah prayer. The BIS administrative office is now located at the Hoover Crescent Islamic Center. Please check our website for more information. Added on May 27, 2005 and last updated 2 years ago

SUNNIAnniston Islamic Center and its Masjid Al-Nur were established as a non-profit organization. The Center serves the religious, educational and social needs of the Muslim community in Calhoun County, surrounding counties and the broader Northeast Alabama region. The Center is managed by a multicultural body of volunteers.Anniston Islamic Center is located approximately 65 miles East of Birmingham, Alabama and 90 miles West of Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL).The mission of the Anniston Islamic Center is to serve the Muslim community, in conjunction with promoting brotherhood, peace and family values. The operational philosophy of the Center is based on the Holy Quran and the Sunnah of the Prophet Muhammad (salallahu alaihi wa salam).Added on May 14, 2011 and last updated 13 years ago
SUNNIISG is dedicated to meet the religious and social needs of the Muslim community and to promote Islamic awareness in Gadsden. Added on May 14, 2011 and last updated 13 years ago

description: SUNNIThe aims and purposes of the IST shall be strictly guided by Islamic principles according to the Qur'an and the Sunnah as understood by Ahl Al Sunnah Wa Al Jama'ah. These principles provide a complete code of conduct to govern the affairs of Islam and serve the best interest of Muslims so as to enable them to adopt Islam as a way of life.Jummah starts at 1:00 pm. SUNNIBIS strives to meet the needs of all Muslims in the greater Birmingham area. In response to the need for a dedicated place of worship in the west side community, BIS established the West Side Masjid in February 2010. The West Side Masjid is located in Fairfield just off of I-20/I-59. The masjid is open daily for five times prayers as well as Jummah prayer on Fridays Added on February 11, 2013 and last updated 11 years ago
